frame.name: Time_period_of_action
frame.definition: <def-root>LUs in this frame denote a period of time in which an <fen>Enabled_action</fen> becomes possible. The <fen>Duration</fen> of this time period can be both exact and inexact. An <fen>Agent</fen> who performs the <fen>Enabled_action</fen> may be mentioned as well. <ex>Allow a <fex name="Duration">three-day</fex> <t>window</t> <fex name="Enabled_action">for delivery</fex>. <fex name="Agent">DNI</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Enabled_action
FE.definition: <def-root>The action that becomes possible through the existence of the period of time.</def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition: <def-root>A quantity or other characterization of the period of the time in which an <fen>Enabled_action</fen>is allowed. In this frame, the duration may be exact or inexact.</def-root>

FE.name: Agent
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen> is the one who performs the <fen>Enabled_action</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Whole
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Whole</fen> is the larger time period to which target is a part of.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: window.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a time period that allows an action to occur
